content: daisy crochet pattern by susanna https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store materials i use worsted weight yarn with an e or f hook cotton yarn is recommended for the petals but not required a small amount of polyfiberfill is used to stuff the center disc and calix and a wooden dowel i use 1/4 diameter and hot glue gun to complete the stem and flower abbreviations round = round chain = chain st = stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet increase = increase decrease = decrease blo = back loop only flo = front loop only special stitches used magic_ring picot chain 2 or 3 as noted in the pattern slip_stitch into the starting chain furthest from the hook notes anytime i work stitches into a foundation chain i work into the back bumps this pattern was constructed the same way i can t say whether not using back bumps would change the appearance since i haven t made it that way feel free to make smaller daisies using lighter weight yarn with a smaller hook ~ 1 ~ daisy crochet pattern by susanna center disc *in round 5 when you make your first blo stitch yellow yarn you may want to mark the now free front loop round 1 make a magic_ring with 6 single_crochet this is where you ll fasten on to begin the petals round 2 single_crochet increase around 12 st round 3 & 4 single_crochet around 12 st round 5* & 6 in blo single_crochet around 12 st stuff lightly round 7 decrease around 6 st https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store sew hole closed and weave in yarn petals i recommend cotton yarn for the petals because it s stiffer and will hold shape better locate the first free front loop from round 5 of the center disc and fasten on with the color of your choice for the flower i use a slip knot and fasten on with a slip_stitch chain 7 starting in the 3rd chain from the hook
